Name: Public information about city-owned property that may be rented.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to public information about city-owned property that may be rented.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Citywide Administrative Services (often called DCAS) to include information about which buildings are available for rental by the public in their public list of City-owned real property. It would also require the list or some other website to allow the public to reserve, rent, and make rental payments with respect to the properties where rental is permitted.

c.\ulnone  For each property managed by the economic development corporation, such list shall include the percentage of usable space actually occupied by a tenant or tenants.\par
[c.] \ul d.\ulnone  Such list shall be made available to the public at no charge on a website maintained by or on behalf of the city of New York in a sortable and searchable format and for download at no charge from such website in a non-proprietary\ul , machine-readable\ulnone  database format.
